newsitem.title: UK: Beckett said UK is not discussing ERM membership.
newsitem.headline: Beckett said UK is not discussing ERM membership.

text.p: The UK Treasury and Department of Trade and Industry said on Tuesday that President of the Board of Trade Margaret Beckett had told a Tokyo television station that Britain was not discussing the issue of ERM membership.
An error of translation led to reports early on Tuesday that she had said a return to the EU's exchange rate mechanism was possible, a Treasury spokesman said.
"They dropped the word "not," the Treasury spokesman said.
The verbatim version of Beckett's comments is:

"We are not discussing the issue of membership of the ERM and in some ways it has become a little bit irrelevant but certainly we do recognise the strong views that are put to us on EMU and out aim is a practical approach.
"We will take, when the time comes, a hard headed decsion as to where Britain's national interest lies."
Sterling quit the ERM in September 1992 when massive foreign exchange speculation meant the government could not hold the currency within its prescribed margins.
